description: Union Minister Piyush Goyal addressed Parliament on the India–U.S. trade deal following PM Modi’s 2025 U.S. visit. He said India safeguarded sensitive sectors like agriculture and dairy, while the U.S. cut tariffs on Indian exports to 18%. The agreement is expected to boost export competitiveness, MSMEs and access to advanced technologies.

'Only deletion, no inclusion': Kalyan Banerjee gives peek into Mamata's SC hearing
description: The Supreme Court heard West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's plea challenging the Election Commission's electoral roll revision, noting two key points in her petition. The court observed that timelines might need extension due to pending cases and issued notices to the EC and CEO for further hearing.

Yamaha EC-06: A measured step into electric mobility
description: Yamaha’s first electric scooter for India focuses on real-world range, everyday performance and familiar ride quality rather than chasing novelty. The EC-06 reflects the brand’s intent to build a credible, long-term presence in the country’s rapidly evolving EV landscape.

title: Volkswagen Tayron R-Line review: The complete package
description: Blending space, performance and premium comfort, the Tayron R-Line marks Volkswagen’s most well-rounded three-row SUV for India yet. With a refined 2.0 TSI engine, confident dynamics and a feature-rich cabin, it sets a new benchmark in its segment.

title: Why is earth’s atmosphere not blown away into space?
Switch from Russia to Venezuela crude oil possible? SBI sees $3 bn savings - explained
description: India could slash its crude import bill by nearly $3 billion annually by strategically shifting from Russian oil to Venezuelan heavy crude. A discount of $10-12 per barrel on Venezuelan oil makes this switch commercially viable, despite longer shipping routes. This potential saving highlights evolving import strategies driven by market dynamics and refining capabilities.

Seven popular car features that people rarely use: Last one is the most loved
description: Modern car features like gesture control and auto park assist often prove impractical for Indian drivers due to inconsistent performance and challenging road conditions. While impressive in showrooms, features such as powered tailgates, rear-seat screens, voice commands, wireless charging, and panoramic sunroofs frequently go unused, with owners preferring simpler, reliable alternatives for daily commutes.

Border 2' box office collection day 13: Film inches towards Rs 290 crore
description: 'Border 2' has seen a strong box office run, crossing Rs 280 crore by its second week. Despite a promising start and a Republic Day boost, the film experienced a decline post-holiday. While facing minimal competition, it's now showing signs of losing momentum ahead of new releases.

title: ‘Fadnavis has no right to talk’: Sharad Pawar says Maharashtra CM was not part of NCP merger talks

description: Carlos Alcarez on Sunday became the youngest male tennis player to complete a career grand slam in the open era. Here is a quiz on the grand slams

'Two fell while trying to save the third': Man who saw Ghaziabad sisters jump from 9th floor at 2am
description: Three minor sisters tragically died after jumping from a ninth-floor Ghaziabad flat early Wednesday. An eyewitness reported one sister appeared to plan the jump, while the other two fell trying to stop her. Police are investigating their alleged addiction to an online gaming app and a handwritten note found at the scene.

title: JEE Main 2026: NTA releases January session provisional answer key, response sheets; raise objections by Feb 6
Higher duty-free limit to gold jewellery reforms: Big relief fro UAE traverllers to India
description: India's new customs baggage rules, effective February 02, 2026, significantly benefit international travellers, especially UAE residents and Indian expats. The duty-free allowance has been raised to ₹75,000 and value caps on gold jewellery are removed, replaced by weight limits. These modernised regulations aim to simplify procedures and enhance passenger convenience.

‘Safeguarded agriculture, dairy': Piyush Goyal hails India-US trade deal in Parliament
description: Union minister Piyush Goyal defended the India-US trade agreement in Lok Sabha, stating India successfully safeguarded its agriculture and dairy sectors after nearly a year of negotiations. The deal, finalized after intensive discussions, aims to promote Indian initiatives and enhance export competitiveness. US President Trump announced a tariff reduction to 18% for Indian products, a move welcomed by PM Modi.

title: Operation Kiya: Two terrorists killed by security forces in J&K's Udhampur
description: Two Jaish-e-Muhammad terrorists were neutralized in a joint operation by the Indian Army, Jammu and Kashmir Police, and CRPF in Udhampur's Basantgarh area. The intense encounter began Tuesday afternoon following specific intelligence inputs about militant movement. Security forces established contact and a firefight ensued, leading to the successful operation.

'I'm a very awkward guy': MS Dhoni reveals why he avoids commentary box and phone calls
description: Mahendra Singh Dhoni has largely ruled out a career in cricket commentary, citing the difficulty in balancing description with criticism and his struggle with memorizing statistics.  He prefers listening and absorbing information rather than speaking, though he humorously admits to still being awkward at phone conversations.

title: JEE Main 2026 session 1 answer key, response sheet released: Check details
description: The National Testing Agency has released the provisional answer key and recorded responses for JEE Main 2026 Session 1. Candidates can now review their answers and submit objections online until February 6, 2026, with a fee of ₹200 per challenge. This crucial step allows students to verify their performance before the final results are announced.

'Traitor' vs 'sadak ka gunda': Rahul, BJP's Bittu face off outside Parliament — Watch
description: A heated exchange occurred between Rahul Gandhi and Union Minister Ravneet Singh Bittu on Parliament steps, escalating into a political war of words. This confrontation happened amidst Opposition protests and the Lok Sabha's adjournment due to the suspension of eight MPs for disrupting proceedings.

title: This IITian took break from job to sell Pani Puri, now owns popular supper club in London
description: Ankita Khante, an IITian, traded her corporate career for a passion for cooking. She started selling Pani Puri from home in London, which led to her popular supper club, The Bouzi Club.  The club offers regional Indian dishes and fosters connection through shared food memories. Ankita is now hosting a supper club in Nagpur.

'Is age a factor?': Dhoni backs Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli to chase 2027 World Cup dream
description: Former captain MS Dhoni supports Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli for the 2027 Cricket World Cup. He believes performance and fitness, not age, should decide their future in ODI cricket. Dhoni emphasises that experienced players offer invaluable guidance to younger teammates. He stated that if they continue to perform and remain fit, they should be considered for selection.

Mumbai–Pune eway in chaos: Mishap sparks 12-hour jam, traffic still paralysed
description: A dramatic incident unfolded on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway when a gas tanker flipped, bringing traffic to a standstill overnight. Cars were rerouted to the older highway as emergency crews scrambled to manage a dangerous leak of propylene gas near the Adoshi tunnel. For over 12 hours, countless drivers found themselves stranded, lacking essential services.

IIT-Bombay student jumps to death from hostel terrace
description: A 21-year-old IIT Bombay student, Naman Agarwal, a second-year BTech Civil Engineering student from Rajasthan, died by suicide after allegedly jumping from a hostel terrace. Campus authorities alerted police, who are investigating the circumstances. No suicide note has been found, and statements are being collected.

title: 'Sorry papa': Heartwrenching suicide note by Ghaziabad sisters before jumping from 9th floor
description: Three young sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, tragically ended their lives by jumping from their ninth-floor Ghaziabad apartment. Investigators believe their alleged addiction to an online gaming app, coupled with parental restrictions and prolonged school absence since the pandemic, may have contributed to the devastating act.

Anganwadi cook saves 20 children from bee attack, gets stung repeatedly, dies
description: In a harrowing display of courage at a Neemuch anganwadi, Kanchan Bai Meghwal emerged as a true hero when she bravely shielded a group of children from an aggressive swarm of bees. Utilizing tarpaulins and mats, she managed to create a barrier, drawing the attention of the furious insects towards herself.

title: Sadhguru relationship advice: Guru urges couples to share joy, not seek it; self-happiness key
description: Spiritual guru Sadhguru suggests shifting from a 'needy' to a 'nurturing' approach in relationships. He advises partners to 'share' rather than 'extract' from each other, viewing them as fellow travelers. Additionally, he emphasizes becoming the 'source of your own happiness,' as complete individuals express love from abundance, not lack, fostering enduring connections.

title: Sector 65 main market in a shambles: Crores spent on drainage, roads remain in ruin; traders distressed
CCTV captures moment car hit Shehzad Poonawalla’s mother at petrol pump
description: In a shocking incident, political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla and BJP representative Shehzad Poonawalla have claimed that their elderly mother was intentionally struck by a vehicle in Pune, resulting in severe injuries that necessitated hip surgery. The harrowing CCTV footage reveals the moment of impact as the car accelerates away from the scene.

No non-veg food near temples? Telangana HC orders state to frame 100m rule for restaurants
Explained: What is Anthropic's AI tool that wiped $285 billion off software stocks in a single day
description: A swift market reaction, dubbed 'SaaSpocalypse,' saw software stocks plummet by $285 billion after Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude Cowork, launched new plugins.  The legal workflow automation plugin, in particular, triggered a selloff in legal tech and broader software sectors. Analysts now fear AI platforms are becoming direct competitors to existing software providers.

title: Sigachi blast case: Telangana HC grants conditional bail to MD Amith Raj Sinha
Bharat Rang Mahotsav comes to Pune, as National School of Drama brings a 60-year legacy to FTII this week
'Justice crying behind closed door': Mamata in SC, leads charge against SIR
description: West Bengal chief minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee approached the Supreme Court to contest the Election Commission's special intensive revision exercise. She had previously met with the Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar to voice her objections, alleging humiliation during the encounter. A Supreme Court bench is set to hear the matter.

Munawwar Rana’s daughter alleges dowry harassment, triple talaq; case filed
description: Hiba Rana, daughter of Urdu poet Munawwar Rana, has filed a police complaint. She alleges dowry harassment and physical assault by her husband, Syed Mohammad Saqib. Rana also claims her husband pronounced triple talaq. An FIR has been registered against Saqib and his father, Syed Haseeb Ahmed. The case involves multiple sections of law.

title: Indian IT stocks crash: Infosys, TCS, Wipro down up to 7% - how a US startup is cause of fall
description: Shares of major IT companies, including Infosys, Wipro, HCL Tech and Persistent Systems, slid as much as 6 per cent in early trade. The negative sentiment mirrored weakness on Wall Street, where the technology-heavy benchmark Nasdaq declined 1.4 per cent, erasing nearly $300 billion in market capitalisation across the sector.

title: Dog on road, delay in care: Rider ‘booked’ for own death in Gujarat
description: A man died after an accident caused by a stray dog, followed by alleged inadequate treatment at two hospitals. His family claims systemic apathy, as he has been booked for his own death due to negligent driving. The police are investigating the sequence of events and hospital treatment records.

title: 'Kept hidden under bed box': 12-year-old employed as house help rescued from Guwahati house
description: A 12-year-old child labourer was rescued from a residence in Guwahati's Panjabari area on Sunday night. Found in poor condition with signs of abuse, the girl had been working as a domestic help for six years. Employers Amarin Akhtar Lashkar and Baharul Haque Lashkar were booked by Dispur police after initially denying the child's presence.

title: Inside China’s gray zone activities: How Beijing is salami slicing its way to influence
description: China is employing a 'salami slicing' strategy, taking incremental steps across military, economic, and technological domains to alter realities without triggering conflict. This 'gray zone' approach, evident in the South China Sea and beyond, bypasses international law and exploits rivals' hesitation. The cumulative effect creates new facts on the ground, challenging the existing order.
